definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: Upon emerging, he refused to bathe and trimmed his hair and nails only once a year.
sentences.chinese: 他不洗澡，理髮和修指甲則是一年一次。

sentences.english: She was sitting manicuring her nails.

sentences.chinese: 修指甲，那是女人的玩意兒”。

sentences.english: Mary is filing her nails with a file.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗正在用一把銼刀修指甲。

sentences.english: Men and women should always be manicured, according to Megaro.
sentences.chinese: Megaro認爲男人和女人都應該修指甲。

sentences.english: The manicurist will be right here.
Manicuring is the care of the hands and nails.
sentences.chinese: 修指甲是手的照料和釘子。

sentences.english: Basic manicuring should be done once a week.
sentences.chinese: 修指甲的基本應該每星期一次被做。

sentences.english: Instead, play a game. Say, "Let's play the manicure game."
sentences.chinese: 相反，遊戲法，說，“讓我們玩修指甲的遊戲。

sentences.english: Bring her into your home and have her shave her head, trim her nails
sentences.chinese: 就可以領她到你家裏去。她便要剃頭髮，修指甲

sentences.english: She was paring her nails with nail scissors .
sentences.chinese: 她正在用指甲刀修指甲。

sentences.english: I'd like to make an appointment for a manicure for tomorrow, please.
sentences.chinese: 我想要預約明天修指甲，麻煩妳。

definition: to win honor/to put on a stern face/to have a facial (beauty treatment)
to have a shave/to enhance the appearance of the face
